Wifi-Hacker-course.title: Certified WiFi Pentesting 101
Wifi-Hacker-course.Short Description: Join us for a practical workshop on WiFi Hacking & Pentesting!
Wifi-Hacker-course.Description: Master the art of WiFi hacking in this beginner-friendly workshop. You'll learn real-world techniques such as Deauthentication attacks, WiFi spam, Evil Twin attacks, and Captive Portal exploitation. This hands-on course is designed for students, cybersecurity enthusiasts, and ethical hackers looking to enhance their wireless pentesting skills. All participants will receive a soft copy of the certificate, course toolkit, and training materials.
What you'll learn: Basics of WiFi Communication and Encryption
How to Set Up Kali Linux for WiFi Pentesting
Deauthentication (Deauth) Attack using Tools
Creating Captive Portals for Credential Harvesting
Evil Twin Attack Setup and Execution
WiFi Spam using Beacon Flooding
How to Stay Anonymous During Attacks
Ethical Usage and Legal Boundaries of Wireless Hacking

Cybersecurity-Career-Webinar-101.title: Cybersecurity Career Webinar 101
Cybersecurity-Career-Webinar-101.Short Description: Understand cybersecurity job roles, required skills, and roadmap in this career-focused webinar.
Cybersecurity-Career-Webinar-101.Description: This free beginner-friendly webinar, conducted by CappricioSec University, will help you explore the various job roles in cybersecurity and understand the skills, tools, and certifications required to enter or switch to this booming industry. Learn from G.A. Harini (CBO, Cappricio Securities) as she breaks down the career roadmap, hiring expectations, and learning resources. All attendees will receive a soft copy of the certificate after completion.
What you'll learn: Cybersecurity Domains & Fundamentals
Career Roadmap for Beginners
Cybersecurity Job Roles (SOC Analyst, Pen Tester, etc.)
Top Certifications and When to Pursue Them
Essential Tools & Skills for Each Role
How to Build a Strong Cybersecurity Resume
LinkedIn Profile Tips for Cyber Aspirants
Resources to Start Practicing

API-Pentesting-Bugbounty-101.title: API Pentesting & Bug Bounty 101
API-Pentesting-Bugbounty-101.Short Description: Learn API hacking from scratch and start your bug bounty journey with this practical, beginner-friendly webinar.
API-Pentesting-Bugbounty-101.Description: This webinar by CappricioSec University offers a complete introduction to API Pentesting and Bug Bounty hunting. Participants will gain practical knowledge in tools like Postman and Burp Suite, learn about OOB testing techniques, and explore API development with Python. You'll also dive into CRUD operations, authentication & authorization flaws, SQL-based issues, and command injection bugs. Perfect for beginners looking to enter the world of API security and ethical hacking. All participants will receive a soft copy of the certificate upon successful completion.
PREREQUISITES: Basic understanding of computers and the internet
Interest in API and web application security
What you'll learn: Introduction to APIs & How They Work
API Hacking Fundamentals
Bug Bounty Mindset & Methodologies
Using Postman & Burp Suite for API Testing
Out-of-Band (OOB) Testing Techniques
API Development Basics with Python
CRUD Operations & Common Vulnerabilities
Authentication & Authorization Testing
Finding SQL and Command Injection Bugs
Steps to Start Your Bug Bounty Journey

Social-Engineering-Ethical-Hacking-101.title: Seminar on Social Engineering
Social-Engineering-Ethical-Hacking-101.Short Description: Explore real-world social engineering attacks and defensive strategies in this beginner-friendly ethical hacking webinar.
Social-Engineering-Ethical-Hacking-101.Description: This webinar by CappricioSec University provides an in-depth overview of social engineering in the context of ethical hacking. Learn how attackers manipulate users, and gain hands-on exposure to phishing simulations, keylogger creation, and the powerful Social-Engineer Toolkit (SET). This session covers different types of attacks, human psychology exploitation, and how to build awareness to defend against these threats. Ideal for students, cybersecurity enthusiasts, and bug bounty beginners. Attendees will receive a certificate of completion.
PREREQUISITES: Basic understanding of computers and networks
Interest in cybersecurity and ethical hacking
Curiosity to learn about human-based attack vectors
What you'll learn: Introduction to Social Engineering Attacks
Types of Social Engineering (Phishing, Pretexting, Baiting, etc.)
How Hackers Trick and Exploit Victims
Using the Social-Engineer Toolkit (SET)
Keylogger Development Basics
Simulating Phishing Portals and Capturing Credentials
Defensive Measures and User Awareness Training
Case Studies from Real-World Scenarios
Ethical Considerations and Reporting
Final Q&A with Certificate Distribution

linuxweb.title: Linux and web bug-bounty bootcamp
linuxweb.Short Description: Practical course on web security using Linux tools — from recon to exploitation and defensive controls.
linuxweb.Description: Hands-on course covering web application reconnaissance, common injection and server-side bugs, header and image based attacks, IDN homograph phishing techniques, rate-limiting bypass strategies, and practical usage of Burp Suite and essential Linux commands for security testing. Designed for students and aspiring ethical hackers who want a solid, practical foundation in web pentesting using a Linux toolchain. Participants receive course materials, toolkit, and a soft copy certificate.
PREREQUISITES: Kali Linux or Linux distro (pre-installed recommended)
Curiosity to practice safely and ethically
What you'll learn: Burp Suite basics and workflow for web testing
Web reconnaissance and footprinting techniques
SSRF identification and exploitation patterns
Injection-based bugs (SQLi, XSS, command injection) detection and exploitation
Rate limiting concepts and bypass mitigation strategies
Header attack vectors (Host, CORS, header injection) and protections
IDN homograph risks and detection methods
Image-based attack examples and secure handling
Essential Linux commands for pentesting (ls, cd, grep, awk, sed, ssh, curl, wget, tar, chmod, etc.)
Ethical guidelines and legal boundaries for responsible testing
